responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Missing input validation in Javascript function fakeSelectRadioButton
    analysis: |
      The function `fakeSelectRadioButton` takes a class name and an ID as input. It then uses these values to construct jQuery selectors. If an attacker can control these inputs, they can inject arbitrary Javascript code into the selector, leading to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - fakeSelectRadioButton
    filenames:
      - src/main/resources/org/biouno/unochoice/stapler/unochoice/unochoice.js
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Missing input validation in Javascript function fakeSelectRadioButton
leads.analysis: The function fakeSelectRadioButton takes a class name and an ID as input. It then uses these values to construct jQuery selectors. If an attacker can control these inputs, they can inject arbitrary Javascript code into the selector, leading to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).
